name: Frosted Sandwich Loaf
author: EWEDIN31
summary: This recipe is very versatile as you can use many different fillings, including thin sliced meats, seafood salad--or make up one of your own. You may use less salad dressing, if you like, in the spreads.
ingredients: ½ cup creamy salad dressing (e.g. Miracle Whip)
½ cup creamy salad dressing (e.g. Miracle Whip)
3 tablespoons creamy salad dressing (e.g. Miracle Whip)
1 (1 pound) loaf white bread, sliced horizontally
directions: In a small bowl, mix together the ground ham, 1/2 cup of salad dressing, 3 tablespoons of relish, and onion
In another bowl, mix together the ground bologna, 3 tablespoons of relish, and 1/2 cup of salad dressing
In a third bowl, stir together 1 package of cream cheese, walnuts, green olives, and 2 tablespoons of milk
In a fourth bowl, mix together the Cheddar cheese, 1 package of cream cheese, 3 tablespoons of salad dressing, onion salt, garlic salt, and celery salt
Spread the ham spread onto the bottom slice of bread, then top with another slice
Cover the next slice with bologna spread, and top with another slice
Spread the next slice with the nut spread, and then top with another slice of bread
Top this slice with the Cheddar cheese spread
Top with one more slice of the bread
Smooth the sides with a large spatula or knife, and refrigerate for about 30 minutes before 'frosting' to make it easier
Mix together the 2 remaining packages of cream cheese, and enough milk to make it spreadable
Frost the sides of the loaf first, then the top
Decorate with sweet pickles and pimentos to your liking
